original: @179a rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @179a rgya gar skad du /

analyzed: a'arya dza ya ba ti n'a ma dh'a ra ni /

analyzed: bod skad du /

analyzed: 'phags pa rgyal ba can zhes bya ba'i gzungs /

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab bya rgod phung po'i ri la dge slong stong du tshang ba'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab bya rgod phung po'i ri la dge slong stong du tshang ba'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in Rājagṛha on the Vulture Peak mountain, together with a great saṅgha of one thousand monks.

original: de nas gnod gyi sde dpon chen po lag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan @179b 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas gnod gyi sde dpon chen po lag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan @179b 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi, the great general of the yakṣas, went to where the Blessed One was, and having arrived, bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and made this request to the Blessed One:

original: sems can thams cad la thugs brtse ba dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / mi'i rgyal po rnams la sman pa dang / bde ba'i slad du bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis rigs ngags kyir gyal mo rgyal ba can zhes bgyi ba 'di bka' stsal du gsol /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la thugs brtse ba dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / mi'i rgyal po rnams la sman pa dang / bde ba'i slad du bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis rigs ngags kyir gyal mo rgyal ba can zhes bgyi ba 'di bka' stsal du gsol /
translated: For the sake of compassion for all sentient beings, for the benefit of all sentient beings, and for the sake of healing and happiness for all human kings, may the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, please proclaim this Victorious Queen of the Lineage.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po lag na rdo rje la thugs brtse bar dgongs te rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rgyal ba can bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po lag na rdo rje la thugs brtse bar dgongs te rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rgyal ba can bka' stsal ba /
translated: Then the Blessed One, thinking with compassion of the great yakṣa general Vajrapāṇi, proclaimed the Victorious Queen of Awareness Spells:

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /

original: khyod kyis rig sngags kyir gyal mo rgyal ba can zhes bya ba /
analyzed: khyod kyis rig sngags kyir gyal mo rgyal ba can zhes bya ba /
translated: you should recite the Victorious Queen of Awareness Spells,

original: sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mas gsungs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mas gsungs pa /
translated: which has been taught by many quintillions of buddhas,

original: byin gyis brlabs pa /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa /

analyzed: lag na rdo rje /

original: 'di dag ni /🔽de bzhi gshegs pas sbyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i gsang sngags kyi gzhi rnams te; lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: 'di dag ni / de bzhi gshegs pas sbyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i gsang sngags kyi gzhi rnams te; lag na rdo rje /
translated: these are🔽the mantra bases for the empowerment conferred by the Tathāgatas on the crown of the head.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i tshig 'di dag gang gi lus la btags sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i tshig 'di dag gang gi lus la btags sam /
translated: Vajrapāṇi, for whoever has these words of empowerment conferred by the Tathāgatas on the crown of the head inscribed on their body

original: glegs bam la bris pa de'i lus dpag tshad steng tshun chad du @180a *//🔽phyir rgol ba'i gnod pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: glegs bam la bris pa de'i lus dpag tshad steng tshun chad du @180a *// phyir rgol ba'i gnod pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or written in a book, their body will be protected up to a yojana🔽and will not be harmed by any adversaries.

original: mtshon dang / dug dang / dbyig dug gis mi tshugs so //
analyzed: mtshon dang / dug dang / dbyig dug gis mi tshugs so //
translated: They will not be harmed by weapons, poison, or sorcery.

original: rgyal po de'i yul der pha rol gyi gnod pam i 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyal po de'i yul der pha rol gyi gnod pam i 'byung ngo //
translated: In the realm of that king, there will be no harm from enemies.

original: phyir rgol ba dag yul 'khor der mthus gnod par mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba dag yul 'khor der mthus gnod par mi 'gyur ro /
translated: The adversaries will not be able to harm that realm with their power.

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las rigs nags kyi rgyal mo rgyal ba can 'di yi ger bris te 'chang ba de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du de'i lus la mtshon dang / dug dang / chu dang / rims dang / dug sbyar ma gzhan gyis mi tshugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las rigs nags kyi rgyal mo rgyal ba can 'di yi ger bris te 'chang ba de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du de'i lus la mtshon dang / dug dang / chu dang / rims dang / dug sbyar ma gzhan gyis mi tshugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: if any son or daughter of noble family writes out and keeps this queen of the secret mantra of the victorious One, the Tathāgata’s heart, for as long as they live, no weapon, poison, water, or contagious disease will be able to harm their body.

original: de la dgra'i 'jigs pa dang / 'che ba dang / mtho 'tsham pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dgra'i 'jigs pa dang / 'che ba dang / mtho 'tsham pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be afraid of enemies, nor will they be harmed or attacked.

original: rgyal po'i 'jigs pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyal po'i 'jigs pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: They will not be afraid of the king.

original: chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa mi 'byung /
analyzed: chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa mi 'byung /
translated: They will not be afraid of thieves.

original: 'thab mo'i nang du song yang de'i lus la mtshon gyis mi phog /
analyzed: 'thab mo'i nang du song yang de'i lus la mtshon gyis mi phog /
translated: Even if they enter into battle, no weapon will be able to strike their body.

original: thams cad du yang nga rgyal ba smra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad du yang nga rgyal ba smra bar 'gyur //
translated: They will be victorious in all their arguments.

original: gnod pa med cing ma snad la ma rmas par rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rgyal ba can 'di'i mthu dang / gzi brjid dang / stobs dang / byin gyi rlabs kyis rgyal bar 'gyur ro //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: the blessings of all the Tathāgatas.

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /

original: mi'i rgyal po gang la la zhig rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rgyal ba can 'di glegs bam la legs par bris te 'chang ngam /🔽lus la btags te 'chang zhing de la spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / me tog @182a *//
analyzed: mi'i rgyal po gang la la zhig rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rgyal ba can 'di glegs bam la legs par bris te 'chang ngam / lus la btags te 'chang zhing de la spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / me tog @182a *//
translated: whatever human king will write out this victorious queen of spells well in a book and keep it,🔽or will keep it attached to his body, and will honor it with various ornaments of incense,

original: sna tshogs kyi lhab lhub kyis bsti stang du byed /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi lhab lhub kyis bsti stang du byed /

original: bla mar byed /🔽ri mor byed /
analyzed: bla mar byed / ri mor byed /

original: mchod par byed /
analyzed: mchod par byed /
translated: will honor it,🔽and will make offerings to it,

original: mi'i rgyal po de la rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu gnod sbyin phyi bzhin 'brang ba bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dang lhan cig tu srung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi'i rgyal po de la rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu gnod sbyin phyi bzhin 'brang ba bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dang lhan cig tu srung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The great king Vaiśravaṇa will protect that human king, together with many hundreds of thousands of yakṣas who follow him.

original: mi'i rgyal po de la phyir rgol ba dang / dgra dang / pha rol gyi dmag tshogs thams cad kyis glags mi rnyed do //
analyzed: mi'i rgyal po de la phyir rgol ba dang / dgra dang / pha rol gyi dmag tshogs thams cad kyis glags mi rnyed do //
translated: No one—no adversary, enemy, or opposing army—will be able to attack that human king.

original: mthus yul der 'jug pa dang / bgegs 'jug na yang rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu bgegs sna tshogs brgya dang / bgegs sna tshogs stong byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthus yul der 'jug pa dang / bgegs 'jug na yang rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu bgegs sna tshogs brgya dang / bgegs sna tshogs stong byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If any of them should try to enter his realm by force, the great king Vaiśravaṇa will create various hundreds of obstacles and various thousands of obstacles.

original: mi'i rgyal po gang dang gang du 'gro ba de dang der rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rgyal ba can 'di rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo la btags te mdun du bkur bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi'i rgyal po gang dang gang du 'gro ba de dang der rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rgyal ba can 'di rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo la btags te mdun du bkur bar bya'o //
translated: Wherever that human king goes, he should hoist this victorious queen of knowledge-mantras on the top of his banner and carry it in front of him.

original: gang du g-yul ngor 'jug gam /
analyzed: gang du g-yul ngor 'jug gam /

original: dgra chen po dang 'thab pa der rig sngags kyi rgyal mo chen mo rgyal ba can 'di mgul du btags te g-yul ngor zhugs na /
analyzed: dgra chen po dang 'thab pa der rig sngags kyi rgyal mo chen mo rgyal ba can 'di mgul du btags te g-yul ngor zhugs na /
translated: If one enters the battlefield wearing this great queen of incantations, Victorious One, on one’s neck,

original: der rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi pus pha rol gyi dmag tshogs de pham par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi pus pha rol gyi dmag tshogs de pham par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, Vajrapāṇi, the great king Vaiśravaṇa will defeat the opposing army.

original: der ni / rgyal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der ni / rgyal bar byed par 'gyur ro //

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo chen mo rgyal bcan 'di su'i mgul du btags pa de rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo chen mo rgyal bcan 'di su'i mgul du btags pa de rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever wears this great queen of incantations, Victorious One, on their neck will be victorious.

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /

original: grong ngam / grong khyer ram /
analyzed: grong ngam / grong khyer ram /

original: grong rdal lam /
analyzed: grong rdal lam /

original: der rig sngags kyi rgyal mo chen mo rgyal ba can 'di dang / me tog sna tshogs dang / chog dang / gtor ma dang / bum pa btud ba sna tshogs kyis bkang ba bzhi phyogs bzhir bzhag ste rig sngags kyir gyal mo chen mo rgyal bcan 'di bklags na /

translated: There, one should place this Victorious Queen of Awareness mantras, along with various flowers, food offerings, sacrificial cakes, and four vases filled with various substances, in the four directions.

analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu tshogs kyi g-yog dang bcas shing /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: mdangs 'phrog pa'i gnod sbyin dang / srin po rnams dang / chos ma yin pa spyod pa'i rgyal po 'byung @184b bar 'gyur ro //
translated: yakṣas and rākṣasas who steal the splendor of others, and kings who act contrary to the Dharma.

original: tshe thung ba chos ma yin pas yul 'khor skyong ba 'byung ba de'i tshe rig sngags kyir gyal mo rgyal ba can 'dis sems can mi mnyam pa dang / sems can mi bzad pa de dag dang / sdang ba dang / rab tu sdang ba'i sems can thams cad kyi don du 'gyur /
analyzed: tshe thung ba chos ma yin pas yul 'khor skyong ba 'byung ba de'i tshe rig sngags kyir gyal mo rgyal ba can 'dis sems can mi mnyam pa dang / sems can mi bzad pa de dag dang / sdang ba dang / rab tu sdang ba'i sems can thams cad kyi don du 'gyur /
translated: When there are those who rule the realm with unrighteousness and have short lives, then this victorious queen of spells will be for the benefit of those beings who are not equal, those terrible beings, and all those beings who are hostile and have a hostile mind.

original: tshar gcod par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshar gcod par 'gyur /

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo chen mo rgyal ba can bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par 'joms par byed pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo chen mo rgyal ba can bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par 'joms par byed pa 'di ni /
translated: This great queen of spells, Jayā, which conquers all the maṇḍalas of Māra,

original: sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mas gsungs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mas gsungs pa /
translated: has been taught by many quintillions of buddhas.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa /

original: phyag rgyas btab pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgyas btab pa'o //

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rgyal ba can 'di ni /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rgyal ba can 'di ni /

original: lha thams cad kyis phyag byas pa'o //
analyzed: lha thams cad kyis phyag byas pa'o //
translated: is revered by all the gods.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la gsang ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la gsang ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi, said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
translated: what is the name of this Dharma discourse?

original: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /

original: de'i phyir khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dang / phyag rgya zhes bya bar yang zungs shig /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dang / phyag rgya zhes bya bar yang zungs shig /
translated: you should remember it as the Tathāgata Essence and the Seal.

original: bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par 'joms par byed pa rgyal ba can zhes bya bar yang zungs shig /
analyzed: bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par 'joms par byed pa rgyal ba can zhes bya bar yang zungs shig /
translated: You should also remember it as the Victorious One that Destroys the Entire Māra’s Assembly.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas gsang ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rje dang / rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin @185a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas gsang ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rje dang / rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin @185a *//
translated: The Blessed One having spoken thus, the Lord of Secrets Vajrapāṇi, the great king Vaiśravaṇa, and the gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced in the words of the Blessed One.

original: dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs ba la mngon bar bstod do //
analyzed: dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs ba la mngon bar bstod do //
translated: The Blessed One having spoken thus, the Lord of Secrets Vajrapāṇi, the great king Vaiśravaṇa, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced and praised the Blessed One’s words.

original: 'phags ba rgyal ba can zhes bya ba'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'phags ba rgyal ba can zhes bya ba'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
translated: The noble Dhāraṇī of the Victorious One is complete.
